title: Jennifer Lawrence's Dior wedding dress had its own hotel room before the big day

Jennifer Lawrence was so determined that her big day went without a hitch, she went to every extreme to ensure this.

The 29-year-old Hunger Games star married Cooke Maroney on Saturday and she wanted to make sure her Dior dress was tip top before tying the knot with the art dealer.

It has been reported that J-Law booked out a room at the Hotel Viking just for the dress, where her "whole design team" looked after it.

A source told People: "The entire Dior team loaded the dress in the car the morning of the wedding."

There is a photo on Instagram of the dress and mannequin bagged up on a trolley, as it arrived at the hotel.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Xavier Collin/Image Press Agency/Splash News / SplashNews.com)

Jennifer married 34-year-old Cooke in front of 150 guests at Belcourt of Newport, a luxurious mansion in Newport, Rhode Island.

Among the guests were Adele, Amy Schumer, Ashley Olsen and Kardashian momager, Kris Jenner.

After the lavish ceremony, guests were treated to snacks from Boston's Baddest Food Truck and Maine-ly Lobstah, as the party continued into the early hours.

(Image: Elder Ordonez / SplashNews.com)

(Image: Elder Ordonez / SplashNews.com)

Kevin Tortorella, the truck’s owner, told People: "People were really nice. We were serving guests until quarter after 3am, and then serving security.”

Jennifer and Cooke stayed until the last guest left at 5.30am, according to a source, who said: "They waited until all the guests were gone so they could personally say goodbye.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

(Image: SplashNews.com)

"When they left, Jen looked happy, but also a bit tired. She also looked stunning in a jeweled dress.”

The wedding comes eight months after it was confirmed that the actress had got engaged, in February, which came less than a year after the couple started dating.
